snippet.textDisplay:
In contrast to certain franchises that never really go anywhere new, Montreal took the basics from the trilogy and changed the progression, battles, setting and visual style, so I don't agree they never tried.

The end result was disappointing, I'll give you that, but why did it turn out that way? Id argue the new PoP's flaws lie in its "innovations" rather than the elements that date back to the trilogy; had Montreal made a ripoff, I think the game wouldnt have been half as bad.
snippet.textOriginal:
In contrast to certain franchises that never really go anywhere new, Montreal took the basics from the trilogy and changed the progression, battles, setting and visual style, so I don't agree they never tried.

The end result was disappointing, I'll give you that, but why did it turn out that way? Id argue the new PoP's flaws lie in its "innovations" rather than the elements that date back to the trilogy; had Montreal made a ripoff, I think the game wouldnt have been half as bad.

snippet.textDisplay: I don't see how it's a ripoff when both are games in the same franchise, developed by (to my knowledge) the same developer, published by the same publisher.
snippet.textOriginal: I don't see how it's a ripoff when both are games in the same franchise, developed by (to my knowledge) the same developer, published by the same publisher.

snippet.textDisplay: There has never been a Prince of Persia for PSX, and the PS2 games were a trilogy. This new Prince of Persia for PS360 indeed marks a (second) reboot of the franchise, but it is in no way a remake.
snippet.textOriginal: There has never been a Prince of Persia for PSX, and the PS2 games were a trilogy. This new Prince of Persia for PS360 indeed marks a (second) reboot of the franchise, but it is in no way a remake.

snippet.textDisplay: PoP 1 and 2 on the PSX and PS2(I think it was), This is a remake from scratch to restart the series into something else they had in mind. But from what other had said to me, they mostly have the same gameplay(Except for terrain actions that got improved.) But I think I pretty much lost the interest for that sort of platform trick game.
snippet.textOriginal: PoP 1 and 2 on the PSX and PS2(I think it was), This is a remake from scratch to restart the series into something else they had in mind. But from what other had said to me, they mostly have the same gameplay(Except for terrain actions that got improved.) But I think I pretty much lost the interest for that sort of platform trick game.
